intro: Tecticornia uniflora, commonly known as the single-flowered tecticornia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its succulent, cylindrical stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant is adapted to arid environments, featuring thick leaves that reduce water loss. It produces small, greenish flowers that are often clustered at the ends of the stems. Tecticornia uniflora is often found in sandy soils and is a common component of dryland ecosystems.
